author: chron.com
title: Culture scene: Oct. 15-21
text:
Photo: Barbara Davis Gallery Image 1 of / 11 11 "Happiness Bleeds" is one of eight large-scale oil paintings in Chicago artist Judy Ledgerwood's solo show "Refrain" Oct. 15-Nov. 14 at Barbara Davis Gallery.
Photo: Barbara Davis Gallery "Happiness Bleeds" is one of eight large-scale oil paintings in... Image 2 of 11 "Ruth Gordon" is among works in Margaret Meehan's solo show "Every Witch Way but Loose" at David Shelton Gallery Oct. 16-Nov. 14.
Photo: David Shelton Gallery "Ruth Gordon" is among works in Margaret Meehan's solo show "Every... Image 3 of 11 Ballerina Anna Holmström will perform with the Flying Steps break-dance crew in the Red Bull "Flying Bach" show ﻿at the Wortham Theater Center.
Photo: Red Bull Ballerina Anna Holmström will perform with the Flying Steps... Image 4 of 11 Ward Sanders' exhibition Howling Fantods: A Tribute to David Foster Wallace" is on view through Oct. 17 at Hooks-Epstein Galleries
Photo: Hooks-Epstein Galleries Ward Sanders' exhibition Howling Fantods: A Tribute to David Foster... Image 5 of 11 Houston sculptors Dylan Conner, Alex Larsen and Patrick Renner played the Surrealist game of exquisite corpse to create the works of "Some Assembly Required," on view through Nov. 4 at G Gallery.
Photo: G Gallery Houston sculptors Dylan Conner, Alex Larsen and Patrick Renner... Photo: Courtesy Of The Artist Jennifer Bornstein's "Trench Coat" is among works on view in... Image 7 of 11 Cheryl Boyd as Samana, and Jeffery Brown as Pops, in this scene from Ensemble Theatre's production of "Plantanos y Collard Greens."
Photo: Gary Fountain, Freelance Cheryl Boyd as Samana, and Jeffery Brown as Pops, in this scene... Image 8 of 11 Troy Schulze, from left, Charlie Scott, Kyle Sturdivant and Amy Bruce in this scene from Catastrophic Theatre's production of Maria Irene Fornes' play "The Danube."
Photo: Gary Fountain, Freelance Troy Schulze, from left, Charlie Scott, Kyle Sturdivant and Amy... Image 9 of 11 Troy Schulze and Amy Bruce star in Catastrophic Theatre's production of ﻿"The Danube."
Photo: Gary Fountain, Freelance Troy Schulze and Amy Bruce star in Catastrophic Theatre's... Image 10 of 11 Amy Bruce and Charlie Scott in this scene from Catastrophic Theatre's production of Maria Irene Fornes' play "The Danube."
Photo: Gary Fountain, Freelance Amy Bruce and Charlie Scott in this scene from Catastrophic... Image 11 of 11 Culture scene: Oct. 15-21 1 / 11 Back to Gallery Theater
One Man, Two Guvnors: The Alley Theatre inaugurates its revamped Hubbard Stage with the Houston premiere of Richard Bean's London and Broadway hit. A reworking of Carlo Goldoni 's 18th-century classic "The Servant of Two Masters," transplanted to 1960s Brighton, the farce centers on a hapless fellow who winds up working for two bosses at the same time and goes to outrageous lengths to keep each from finding out about the other. 7:30 p.m. Tuesdays-Thursdays, 8 p.m. Fridays, 2:30 and 8 p.m. Saturdays, 2:30 and 7:30 p.m. Sundays, through Nov. 1; Alley Theatre, 615 Texas; $21-$68; 713-220-5700, alleytheatre.org .
Matilda: National tour brings the Houston premiere of the London and Broadway hit based on Roald Dahl 's children's classic. With book by Dennis Kelly , music and lyrics by Tim Minchin , the musical chronicles the travails and triumphs of Matilda, a young girl who uses her love of books, plus emerging telekinetic powers, to cope with her horrid parents and the even more horrible headmistress of her school. 7:30 p.m. Thursday, 8 p.m. Friday, 2 and 8 p.m. Saturday, 2 and 7:30 p.m. Sunday tour presented by TUTS at Hobby Center , 800 Bagby; $30-$100; 713-558-8887, tuts.com .
Pippin: National tour brings director Diane Paulus ' Tony-winning revival of Stephen Schwartz and Roger O. Hirson 's classic musical about King Charlemagne 's son and his search for a meaningful life; Opens at 7:30 p.m. Tuesday; through Oct. 25; Broadway at the Hobby Center, 800 Bagby; $25-$105; 800-982-2787; broadwayatthehobbycenter.com .
Peter Pan 360: J.M. Barrie 's classic fantasy, about the boy who refuses to grow up, returns in this touring big-top production, with elaborate 360-degree projections and flying effects. 7:30 p.m. Tuesdays-Fridays, 11:30 a.m., 3:30 and 7:30 p.m. Saturdays, 1:30 and 5:30 p.m. Sundays, through Nov. 1. Threesixty Theatre , 4747 U.S. 59 S.; $25-$75; 800-745-3000, peterpan360.com, ticketmaster.com .
The Elaborate Entrance of Chad Deity : Kristoffer Diaz 's satiric comedy chronicles clashes of personalities, ethnic identities and management in the world of professional wrestling. Previews Thursday, opens Friday; 7:30 p.m. Wednesdays-Thursdays, 8 p.m. Fridays-Saturdays, 3 p.m. Sundays, through Nov. 8; Stages Repertory Theatre , 3201 Allen Parkway; $23-$49; 713-527-0123, stagestheatre.com .
The Honky Tonk Angels: Ted Swindley's musical about three aspiring country singers who meet on a Nashville-bound bus. 7:30 p.m. Wednesdays-Thursdays, 8 p.m. Fridays-Saturdays, 3 p.m. Sundays, through Nov. 8; Stages Repertory Theatre, 3201 Allen Parkway; $23-$49; 713-527-0123, stagestheatre.com .
Plantanos y Collard Greens: David Lamb 's comedy about an African-American man and a Latina woman who fall in love but find their relationship challenged by the prejudices and misconceptions of their families and friends. 7:30 p.m. Thursday, 8 p.m. Friday, 2 and 8 p.m. Saturday, 3 p.m. Sunday; Ensemble Theatre , 3535 Main; $23-$50; 713-520-0055, ensemblehouston.com .
The Danube: In Marie Irene Fornes ' experimental play, characters in 1938 Budapest find themselves falling prey to a mysterious sickness. 8 p.m. Thursday-Saturday; Catastrophic Theatre , 1119 I-10 E.; pay-what-you-can admission; 713-522-2723, catastrophictheatre.com .
Henry V : "Gender-blind" casting puts a new spin on Shakespeare's history play. Previews Thursday, opens Friday; 8 p.m. Thursdays-Saturdays, 2:30 p.m. Sundays, through Nov. 1; also, 8 p.m. Monday and Oct. 28; Classical Theatre Company , 4617 Montrose; $25; 713-963-9665, classicaltheatre.org .
Freud's Last Session: Mark St. Germain's play imagines a meeting between Sigmund Freud and C.S. Lewis . 7:30 p.m. Thursdays, 8 p.m. Fridays-Saturdays, 2:30 p.m. Sundays, through Nov. 8; A.D. Players , 2710 W. Alabama; $40; 713-526-2721, adplayers.org .
Dracula: Mac Wellman's version of the horror tale focuses on Dracula's victims, Lucy and Mina. 8 p.m. Thursdays-Sundays through Oct. 31; also, 3 p.m. Oct. 25; Mildred's Umbrella Theatre Company , Studio 101, 1824 Spring; $20; 832-463-0409, mildredsumbrella.com .
You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown : Clark Gesner 's long-running 1960s off-Broadway musical based on Charles Schulz 's "Peanuts" comic strip, in the revised 1999 Broadway edition. 2 p.m. Saturdays, 5 p.m. Sundays, through Oct. 24; Bayou City Theatrics at the Kaleidoscope, 705 Main; $35; 832-817-8656, bayoucitytheatrics.com .
Dog Sees God: Confessions of a Teenage Blockhead: Bert Royal 's 2005 off-Broadway comedy is an unauthorized parody/sequel that shows Charlie Brown and other regulars of the "Peanuts" comic strip negotiating an uneasy adolescence. 8 p.m. Fridays-Saturdays, through Oct. 24; Bayou City Theatrics at the Kaleidoscope, 705 Main; $35; 832-817-8656, bayoucitytheatrics.com .
FuenteOvejuna: Lope de Vega 's play about a village overtaken by a tyrant. 8 p.m. Thursday-Saturday, 2 p.m. Sunday; University of Houston School of Theatre and Dance production, at Jose Quintero Theatre , UH campus; $10-$20; 713-743-2929, theatredance.uh.edu .
A ... My Name Is Alice: Musical revue with a girl-power theme. 7:30 p.m. Thursdays, 8 p.m. Fridays-Saturdays, 3 p.m. Sundays, through Nov. 7; Texas Repertory Theatre Co. , 14243 Stuebner Airline; $43; 781-583-7573, texasreptheatre.org .
Into the Woods: Stephen Sondheim and James Lapine 's fairy-tale musical. 7:30 p.m. Fridays-Saturdays, 3 p.m. Sundays, through Nov. 8; 3 p.m. Oct. 31, no evening show that day; $26; Houston Family Arts Center , 10760 Grant; 281-587-6100, houstonfac.com .
The Rocky Horror Show: Richard O'Brien 's campy rock musical spoofing horror movies. 8 p.m. Fridays-Saturdays through Wednesday. Playhouse 1960, 6814 Gant; $18; playhouse1960.com .
Autumn in New York: Cabaret revue collects songs associated with New York performers such as Paul Simon , Barbra Streisand and Billy Joel . 7:30 p.m. Fridays-Saturdays, through Oct. 24; also, 2 p.m. Sunday; Music Box Theatre , 2623 Colquitt; $27-$37; 713-522-7722, themusicboxtheater.com .
Everything in the Garden: Edward Albee 's play about suburban mores and materialism. 8 p.m. Fridays-Saturdays, 3 p.m. Sundays, through Nov. 1; Pasadena Little Theatre , 4318 Allen-Genoa; $20; 713-941-1758, pasadenalittletheatre.org .
Classical music
Houston Symphony: Andrés Orozco-Estrada conducts Ives' Symphony No. 2 and Brahms Piano Concerto No. 2, with Emanual Ax. 8 p.m. Friday-Saturday, 2:30 p.m. Sunday; Jones Hall , 615 Louisiana; $25-$129; 713-224-7575, houstonsymphony.org .
Houston Heights Orchestra : Season-opening concert features Schubert's "Unfinished" Symphony, works by Liszt and Mozart. 3 p.m. Sunday; Resurrection Metropolitan Community Church , 2025 W. 11th; $10; 281-610-4607.
Houston Early Music: The Rose Ensemble performs "Music From the Land of Three Faiths: Voices of Ancient Mediterrranean Jews, Christians and Muslims," with the Concert Chorale of Bellaire High School. 5 p.m. Sunday; St. Philip Presbyterian Church , 4807 San Felipe; $40; houstonearlymusic.org .
Voca People: The a cappella "beat box" octet applies its unique vocal stylings to musical gems, from Mozart to Michael Jackson . 7:30 p.m. Friday; Wortham Center, 801 Texas; $28-$68; 713-227-4772, spahouston.org .
Dance
Red Bull 'Flying Bach': Swedish ballerina Anna Holmström performs with the break-dance crew Flying Steps in a show that puts electronic beats to Johann Sebastian Bach 's "The Well-Tempered Clavier." 7:30 Tuesday-Wednesday; additional performances through Sunday; Wortham Theater Center , 501 Texas; $35-$85; 800-745-3000, houstonfirsttheaters.com .
'So You Think You Can Dance' Tour 2015: The top 10 finalists of the Emmy-winning reality show's Season 12 perform; 8 p.m. Saturday, Revention Music Center, 520 Texas; $35-$75, 713-230-1600, reventionmusiccenter.com .
Splendid China: Dance of Asian America performs; 7:30 p.m. Friday-Saturday; Miller Outdoor Theatre, 6000 Hermann Park Drive; 832-487-7102, milleroutdoortheatre.com . FREE
Sunset at White Oak Bayou: Karen Stokes Dance premieres a site-specific piece with a commissioned score by Brad Sayles, played live by Heights 5 Brass, 5:30 and 6:15 p.m. Sunday, Wood street at White Oak Bayou downtown; reservations necessary; karenstokesdance.org . FREE
Art museums
Art League Houston: "Amy Blakemore: I Ain't Tellin' " and "Forrest Prince: The Greatest of All Is Love," through Nov. 7; 1953 Montrose; 713-523-9530, artleaguehouston.org . FREE
Asia Society Texas Center: "Drawn From Nature," through Feb. 21; $5; 1370 Southmore; 713-496-9901, asiasociety.org .
Blaffer Art Museum: "Time/Image" and "Zina Saro-Wiwa: Did You Know We Taught Them How to Dance?," through Dec. 12; 4173 Elgin; 713-743-9521, blafferartmuseum.org . FREE
Contemporary Arts Museum Houston: "Texas Design Now," through Nov. 29; and "Whispering Bayou," through Nov. 1; 5216 Montrose; 713-284-8250, camh.org . FREE
DiverseWorks: "Katie Grinnan: Nocturnal Hologram," through Nov. 14; 4102 Fannin, Suite 200; 713-223-8346, diverseworks.org . FREE
FotoFest: "This Side of Paradise: New Photographic Work by Texas Artists," through Nov. 14; 2000 Edwards; 713-223-5522, fotofest.org . FREE
Galveston Arts Center: "Elinor Evans: A Force of Nature: 101," through Nov. 28; 2501 Market, Galveston; 409-763-2403, gavestonartscenter.org . FREE
Holocaust Museum Houston: "Roman Vishniac," through Jan. 24, and Michael Roque Collins' "Sojourn in the Shadowlands," through March 13; 5401 Caroline; 713-942-8000, hmh.org .
Houston Center for Contemporary Craft: "What Happened Today?/The Collective Cover Project," two large-scale installations by Ann Morton; and "Wendy Maruyama: The wildLIFE Project," through Jan. 3; 4848 Main; 713-529-4848, crafthouston.org . FREE
Houston Center for Photography: "This Side of Paradise: New Photographic Work by Texas Artists," opens Thursday, through Nov. 14; 1441 W. Alabama; 713-529-4755, hcponline.org . FREE
Katy Contemporary Arts Museum: "Deconstruction Beauty," works by Ken Mazzu and Felipe Lopez, through Nov. 15; 805 Ave. B, Katy; 832-857-1340, katycam.com .
Menil Collection: "Apparitions: Frottages and Rubbings From 1860 to Now," through Jan. 3; "Affecting Presence and the Pursuit of Delicious Experiences," through Nov. 8; "MicroCosmos: Details From the Carpenter Collection of Arctic Art," through Feb. 21; 1533 Sul Ross; 713-525-9400, menil.org . FREE
Museum of Fine Arts, Houston: "Mark Rothko: A Retrospective," through Jan. 24; "Roman Vishniac Rediscovered," through Jan. 3; "Shadow Monsters," through Oct. 31; $7.50-$23; 5601 Main; 713-639-7300, mfah.org .
Rice Gallery: Anila Quayyum Agha's light and shadow installation "Intersections," through Dec. 6; Sewall Hall, Rice University, 6100 Main; 713-348-6069, ricegallery.org . FREE
Station Museum of Contemporary Art: "Corpocracy," featuring 13 artists who explore capitalism and corporate culture, through Feb. 14; 1502 Alabama, 713-529-6900, stationmuseum.com . FREE
Watercolor Art Society: 46th Annual Members exhibit, opens 6 p.m. Friday, through Nov. 5; 1601 W. Alabama, 713-942-4433, watercolorhouston.org .
